name: Indiana Aerospace University
about: Indiana Aerospace University, established in 1992, is the Philippines' first and only Aerospace University. Located in Lapu-lapu City, Cebu, it was founded to address the growing demand for skilled professionals in aeronautics and aviation, driven by the expansion of Mactan-Cebu International Airport. IAU offers a range of degree programs, including Aerospace Engineering, Airline Management, Aircraft Maintenance Technology, Avionics, and Aviation Technology-Major in Flying. The university also provides specialized training courses such as Private Pilot License, Commercial Pilot License, Instrument Rating, and Flight Instructor courses. With state-of-the-art facilities, including CAAP-approved flight simulators and a fully owned hangar and taxiway, IAU is committed to producing globally competitive graduates dedicated to aerospace knowledge and skills. IAU fosters academic prowess, moral excellence, and holistic development, preparing students for fulfilling careers in aviation.
